meanings.definition: Most solid or firm in structure or substance.
meanings.sent1: The wall made of bricks is the solidest in the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The concrete foundation is the solidest part of the building.
meanings.sent3: The solidest rock in the garden refused to budge when I tried to move it.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve to finish the project was as solidest as a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The solidest oak tree stood tall against the storm.

meanings.sent1: Out of all my friends, Sarah is the solidest when it comes to keeping secrets.
meanings.sent2: The old librarian was known to be the solidest source of information in town.
meanings.sent3: The solidest alarm clock failed to wake me up this morning, causing me to be late.
meanings.sent4: His handshake was as solidest as a promise engraved in stone.
meanings.sent5: The solidest anchor held the ship steady in the rough sea.

meanings.sent1: The solidest argument in the debate convinced everyone of its validity.
meanings.sent2: The foundation of the building was the solidest part, ensuring its stability.
meanings.sent3: The solidest tree in the forest was actually a cleverly disguised robot.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solidest as a steel beam.
meanings.sent5: The solidest bridge withstood the weight of the heavy trucks passing over it.
